Type =====--> <!--===================================================================--> <xsd:complexType name="AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:UniqueID>UNDT000001</ccts:UniqueID> <ccts:Acronym>CCT</ccts:Acronym> <ccts:DictionaryEntryName>Amount. Type</ccts:DictionaryEntryName> <ccts:Version>2.01</ccts:Version> <ccts:Definition>A number of monetary units specified in a currency where the unit of the currency is explicit or implied.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm>Amount</ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm> <ccts:PrimitiveType>decimal</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:attribute name="currencyID" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Amount. Currency. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The currency of the amount.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="currencyCodeListVersionID" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Amount Currency. Code List Version. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The VersionID of the UN/ECE Rec9 code list.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <!--===================================================================--> <!--===== Binary Object. Type =====--> <!--===================================================================--> <xsd:complexType name="BinaryObjectType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:UniqueID>UNDT000002</ccts:UniqueID> <ccts:Acronym>CCT</ccts:Acronym> <ccts:DictionaryEntryName>Binary Object. Type</ccts:DictionaryEntryName> <ccts:Version>2.01</ccts:Version> <ccts:Definition>A set of finite-length sequences of binary octets.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm>Binary Object</ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm> <ccts:PrimitiveType>binary</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:base64Binary"> <xsd:attribute name="format" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Binary Object. Format. Text</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The format of the binary content.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="mimeCode" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Binary Object. Mime. Code</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The mime type of the binary object.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="encodingCode" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Binary Object. Encoding. Code</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>Specifies the decoding algorithm of the binary object.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="characterSetCode" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Binary Object. Character Set. Code</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The character set of the binary object if the mime type is text.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="uri" type="xsd:anyURI" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Binary Object. Uniform Resource. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The Uniform Resource Identifier that identifies where the binary object is located.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="fileName" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Binary Object. File. Name</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The filename of the binary object.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <!--===================================================================--> <!--===== Code. Type =====--> <!--===================================================================--> <xsd:complexType name="CodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:UniqueID>UNDT000003</ccts:UniqueID> <ccts:Acronym>CCT</ccts:Acronym> <ccts:DictionaryEntryName>Code. Type</ccts:DictionaryEntryName> <ccts:Version>2.01</ccts:Version> <ccts:Definition>A character string (letters, figures, or symbols) that for brevity and/or languange independence may be used to represent or replace a definitive value or text of an attribute together with relevant supplementary information.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm>Code</ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> <ccts:UsageRule>Should not be used if the character string identifies an instance of an object class or an object in the real world, in which case the Identifier. Type should be used.</ccts:UsageRule> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:token"> <xsd:attribute name="listID" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Code List. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The identification of a list of codes.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="listAgencyID" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Code List. Agency. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>An agency that maintains one or more lists of codes.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="listAgencyName" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Code List. Agency Name. Text</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The name of the agency that maintains the list of codes.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="listName" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Code List. Name. Text</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The name of a list of codes.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="listVersionID" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Code List. Version. Type</ccts:DictionaryEntryName> <ccts:Version>2.01</ccts:Version> <ccts:Definition>A character string (i.e. a finite set of characters) generally in the form of words of a language.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm>Text</ccts:PrimaryRepresentationTerm> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="languageID" type="xsd:language" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Language. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The identifier of the language used in the content component.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="languageLocaleID" type="xsd:token" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:Name>Language Locale. Identifier</ccts:Name> <ccts:Definition>The identification of the locale of the language.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>string</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <!--==================================================================--> <!--===== Type Definition: DateType =====--> <!--==================================================================--> <xsd:complexType name="DateType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:UniqueID>UDT000009</ccts:UniqueID> <ccts:Acronym>UDT</ccts:Acronym> <ccts:DictionaryEntryName>Date. Type</ccts:DictionaryEntryName> <ccts:Version>2.01</ccts:Version> <ccts:Definition>A particular point in the progression of time together with the relevant supplementary information.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:PrimitiveType>String</ccts:PrimitiveType> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="DateString"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="xsd:string"> <xsd:attribute name="format" type="xsd:string" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en"> <ccts:UniqueID/> <ccts:Acronym>SC</ccts:Acronym> <ccts:DictionaryEntryName>Date Time. Format. Text</ccts:DictionaryEntryName> <ccts:Definition>The format of the date/time content.</ccts:Definition> <ccts:ObjectClassTerm>Date Time</ccts:ObjectClassTerm> <ccts:PropertyTerm>Format</ccts:PropertyTerm> </xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Date" type="xsd:date"/> </xsd:choice> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="URIType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>anyURI represents a Uniform Resource Identifier Reference (URI). An anyURI value can be absolute or relative, and may have an optional fragment identifier (i.e., it may be a URI Reference). This type should be used to specify the intention that the value fulfills the role of a URI as defined by [RFC 2396], as amended by [RFC 2732]</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:anyURI"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="DurationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Duration represents a duration of time. The value space of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively. These components are ordered in their significance by their order of appearance i.e. as year, month, day, hour, minute, and second</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:duration"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="PercentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A percent is a value representing a fraction of one hundred, expressed as a quotient -- Usage Percent. Type is used to represent a percentage that indicates how many hundredths of a basic value are to be calculated. The result of the calculation is the proportion in percent of, e.g., amounts, values, rates, discounts, and taxes. For example, "8.25%" should be passed as "8.25", "10%" should be passed as "10" or "10.0" etc, "150%" should be passed as "150" or "150.0" etc.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:decimal"/> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:schema>

Schema Definition for Meta

 The set of Identifiers for the VBO or component. These should be used to uniquely identifier instances of the business object or component. The identifier of the business object or component. This should be used to identify instances of a business object or component. Where the component is being used to reference another business object then this is the primary key of the target object. Use the attributes @schemeName and @schemeAgencyName to identify type of Identifier. The name of the instance of a business object or component. A free text description of a business object or component. The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component. Base type for all business objects and some components. A classification of the business object or component. This identifies the sub-type of the instance of object or component. The set of classifications for the business object or component. A classification applied to the business object or component. More than one classification scheme can be applied using the @listName attribute to identify the type of code list being used. The classification scheme can be used to group instances of the object or component. An indication of the hierarchy level of the category when involved in a hierarchical classification, e.g. level 1 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=1, level 2 -> Category/@listHierarchyID=2. In this case the listName should be the same for each level to show their relationship. The lifecycle state of the business object or component. This field is used to track the specific state an instance of an object or component is in, e.g. the Customer Bill is Active or the Customer Request has been Cancelled. Extended Common base type for all Vodafone Objects. This also includes Status. A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a business object or component. This field should be used in support of multi-agent environments to control the concurrency (locking) of the instance. The date and time the business object or component was created. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used. The unique ID of the User that created the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User. The date and time the business object or component was last modified. A date and time formatted in compliance with the ISO8601 standard must be used. The unique ID of the User that last modified the instance of the business object or component. This should be used as a reference to the IDM system and the details about that User. A component that states the date and time from which this business object is effective (or valid) and the date and time to which it is effective. Again the ISO8601 standard must be used. A field representing the date and time on which business activity was last made on this business object or component. The date and time must conform to the ISO8601 standard. A component that states the date and time from which this business object is effective (or valid) and the date and time to which it is effective. Again the ISO8601 standard must be used. The date from which the business object or component is effective. The date to which the business object or component is effective. A component representing an expression of a query criteria used in a Get List. For example, find me the matching set of business objects where the Path Equals the Value. The Equals being the operator code, e.g. equals, less than, etc. The value to be matched in a query criteria. The repeating structure allows more than one value to be specified, these must be taken as an implict OR function, i.e. This Value-1 OR Value-2 OR Value-3. The value from the codelist representing the operator to apply between the Path and the Value. Examples include Equals, Less Than, etc. The path to the field within the business object to be used in the query. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference. A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated out of a series of value expressions (criteria). The value to be matched in a query criteria. The repeating structure allows more than one value to be specified, these must be taken as an implict OR function, i.e. This Value-1 OR Value-2 OR Value-3. A field indicating how consecutive query expression should be evaluated, e.g. Condition-1 AND Condition-2. An indicator of whether the query expression should have a NOT applied to it, i.e. does NOT equal or is NOT less than. A data object that allows simple and complex query criteria to be specified against which a set of business objects can be matched. A data object that allows simple and complex query criteria to be specified against which a set of business objects can be matched. A field that supports the specification of pagination by a requester. The start index indicates the number of the instance matching the query criteria from which the page to be returned starts. A field that supports the specification of the size of the page to be returned in a query. A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated out of a series of value expressions (criteria). The value to be matched in a query criteria. The repeating structure allows more than one value to be specified, these must be taken as an implict OR function, i.e. This Value-1 OR Value-2 OR Value-3. A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated. The implicit operator between differnt QueryExpression is logical AND. For mode details about complex queries check the Consumer and Implementation Guide. A component holding the specification of the sorting required on the query. A component within the query that specifies a specific instance of a business to retrieve. The ID specified represents the primary key of the business object as configured through the IDs/ID[/@schemeName=''] field. A component that allows the consumers to ask for a partial response. Instead of returning the complete API response, the consumer can ask only for subset of the datamodel to be returned. A set of rules are currently in place around the Partial Response, for more information check the ConsumerAndImplementation Guide. The path to the field within the business object to be used in the partial response.This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference. A component holding the specification of the sorting required on the query. The path by which to sort the result set returned from the query. The direction by which to sort a set of values. The collation (sort) algorithm to use in the sorting to the result set A characteristic, normally used through a Specification. This allows traits of the parent business object to be configured. The name of the characteristic. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value) The value of the characteristic. For example: Colour (name) is Black (value) A data object that allows report specification to be specified against various business objects for the calculation of aggregate functions. Specifies the details of the data set on which to report. Specifies the details of the data set on which to report. A query expression that allows complex queries to be formulated out of a series of value expressions. A grouping expression that allows unique attribute from business object for the grouping to build report. An aggregate function that allows statitics function to be specified for building the report A grouping expression that allows attributes from business object for the grouping to build statitics. The path to the field within the business object to be used for the grouping. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference. An aggregate function that allows statistics function to be specified for building the report The path to the field on which to make the calculation. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference. To provide a report on the statictics (aggregate functions) for a specific data set within the bounds of a business object. A specific line item in the report containing the result of aggregate function calculation on the given data set. A specific line item in the report containing the result of aggregate function calculation on the given data set. A column (field) in the report lint item, either a field from the source VBO being part of the grouping expression or a calculated field. A column (field) in the report lint item, either a field from the source VBO being part of the grouping expression or a calculated field. The path to the field on which to make the calculation. This field must use an XPath notation as per the MBP to provide a unique reference. An aggregate function that allows statistics function to be specified for building the report The value of the source VBO field or the calculated value of an aggregate function.

Schema Definition for CodeLists

 ID of the object is returned by the service OR Entire Object that was created/ updated is returned by the service The direction by which to sort a set of values. The collation (sort) algorithm to use in the sorting to the result set A code list restricting values to the ISO3166-Alpha 2 country codes.

Schema Definition for Vodafone Fault Object

 Do not use in domain specific schema, provided for the sole purpose of generating examples. The fault object used to hold in-house Vodafone values for an error occurring within a middleware component, intended to be used as part of a SOAP:detail tag within the fault as per the SOAP 1.1 specification. A human readable short text name for the fault. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Success" if the object is being used to indicate success. The degree of severity and impact the fault has inccured, provides an indication of the level that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Information" if the object is being used to indicate success. A classification of the fault indicating whether it has been generated through some technical aspect of the interaction or on account of a failure of business logic, rules or processing. It provides an indication of the type that may be used to trigger different behaviours in the consumer. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Business" if the object is being used to indicate success. An enumeration of the reasons why the fault has been generated by the provider. Currently this is not used. A human readable description of the fault as identified by the Error Code. Required if the Error Code >= 100, may be omitted or set to "Successfully processed" if the object is being used to indicate success. A component that allows characteristics of the fault to be specified in addition to those specifically asked for, e.g. Category, Severity, etc. A characteristic of the fault, these have both a name and a value. A component that describes individual failures within the fault. This component is used to support multiple causes to the fault, i.e. where the fault is generated from one or more API calls or one or more validation failures. A component that describes individual failures within the fault. This component is used to support multiple causes to the fault, i.e. where the fault is generated from one or more API calls or one or more validation failures. The code identifying the specific failure. The human-readable text of the specific failure. A reference to the specific field or component within the VBO that generated the failure. A reference to the specific field or component within the VBO that generated the failure. The pseudo-XPath reference to the specific field or component within the VBO. The value of the field referenced by the Path Name.

About the XML namespace

This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.

See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.

Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The names currently defined in this namespace are listed below. They should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance.

See further below in this document for more information about how to refer to this schema document from your own XSD schema documents and about the namespace-versioning policy governing this schema document .

lang (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

Notes

Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility.

See BCP 47 at http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt and the IANA language subtag registry at http://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry for further information.

The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.

space (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

base (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.

id (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the xml:id specification.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.

Father (in any context at all)

denotes Jon Bosak, the chair of the original XML Working Group. This name is reserved by the following decision of the W3C XML Plenary and XML Coordination groups:

In appreciation for his vision, leadership and dedication the W3C XML Plenary on this 10th day of February, 2000, reserves for Jon Bosak in perpetuity the XML name "xml:Father".

About this schema document

This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base , xml:lang , xml:space or xml:id attributes on elements they define.

To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows:

<schema . . .>
           . . .
           <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
                      schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd"/>

or

<import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
                      schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd"/>

Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.

<type . . .>
           . . .
           <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>

will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes.

Versioning policy for this schema document

In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd .

At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd .

The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd will not change.

Previous dated (and unchanging) versions of this schema document are at:

  • http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2007/08/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2004/10/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd

Schema Definition for Vodafone Header Object

Added element definition for all complextypes - 20-02-2015

 All request messages must have an identifiable source, or consumer information The Language Code of the source system. This must adhere to the ISO639 Language Codes. To understand the correlation between the execution of a service and from where it originated, MessageID and CorrelationID are mapped via WS-Addressing

An ISO3166-Alpha 2 Country Code should be used here.

An ISO639 Language Code should be used here.

 Mandatory cache parameter support by all services (a service must understand the directive even if no caching support in the service – this allows for future extensibility of the service implementation) Use cache during queries by default (code may override this). Cache must be ignored, retrieve data from the back-end instead The service can decide whether or not to use a cache Documentation data structure exposes implementation details – violates the service abstraction principle. To prevent consumers from using, any public service response or perimeter response must strip out the documentation data

A type representing the headers describing the destination or target system in an interaction. If used in the request message then this is an indication of the required destination and maybe used for routing. The original destination as understood by the source may be changed when the message is in flight. If used in the response message then this should be taken as a description of the actual destination (target) system.

 The Country Code of the destination system. This must adhere to the ISO3166-Alpha2 Country Codes. The Language Code of the destination system. This must adhere to the ISO639 Language Codes. A header providing meta-data about the result of a query. A header providing meta-data about the result of a query. The total number of records matched in the query and possibly returned in the payload of the response message. The collation alogrithm that was used to sort the response to a query. A header providing additional routing discriminators that can be used in the context of routing rules A header providing additional routing discriminators that can be used in the context of routing rules The identifier of the route definition. This should be used to identify instances of routes. The priority of the Key relative to other Keys present in the same route. The set of additional keys for the routing purposes. The Key allows the consumer to pass aditional information relevant to the producer in order to perform the routing of the message to the appropriate system/component The name of the characteristic The priority of the Key relative to other Keys present in the same route.

Vodafone Business Message Schema Definition for Customer Bill

 Type definition for the GetCustomerBillList request payload. Type definition for the GetCustomerBillList response payload. Type definition for the GetCustomerBillSummaryList request payload. Type definition for the GetCustomerBillSummaryList response payload. Type definition for the GetCustomerBillLineItemList request payload. Type definition for the GetCustomerBillLineItemList response payload. Type definition for the NotifyCustomerBill request payload. A value representing the event that occurred on the publishing system to generate this notify event. A value representing the business event that occurred on the publishing system to generate this notify event. Type definition for the SyncCustomerBill request payload. A value representing the event that occurred on the publishing system to generate this notify event. A value representing the business event that occurred on the publishing system to generate this notify event. Type definition for the SyncCustomerBill response payload.

Vodafone Group Services Limited - Confidential--> <xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/vbo/payment/customer-bill/v1" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:tns="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/vbo/payment/customer-bill/v1" xmlns:extvbo="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/extension/vbo/payment/customer-bill/v1" xmlns:cct="urn:un:unece:uncefact:documentation:standard:CoreComponentType:2" xmlns:cmn="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/common/v1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Schema definition for Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:import namespace="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/common/v1" schemaLocation="CommonComponents.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/extension/vbo/payment/customer-bill/v1" schemaLocation="ExtendedCustomerBillVBO.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="urn:un:unece:uncefact:documentation:standard:CoreComponentType:2" schemaLocation="CoreComponentType_2p0.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://group.vodafone.com/schema/common/v1" schemaLocation="Meta.xsd"/> <!--To be Removed--> <xsd:element name="CustomerBillVBO" type="tns:CustomerBillVBOType"/> <xsd:element name="CustomerBillSummaryVBO" type="tns:CustomerBillSummaryVBOType"/> <xsd:element name="CustomerBillLineItemVBO" type="tns:CustomerBillLineItemVBOType"/> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillVBOType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer Bill Enterprise Service provides access, by the target consumers (section 4.2 of the BSS), to a customer’s billing data. This is generated within the billing backend system on a particular date within a customer’s billing cycle. Once generated the Bill must be considered read-only, i.e. it cannot be modified.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:ExtendedBaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Details" type="tns:CustomerBillDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The list of fields (data items) directly associated with a Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RelatedCustomerBills" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="RelatedCustomerBill" type="tns:RelatedCustomerBillReferenceType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference from this Customer Bill to another.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Roles" type="tns:CustomerBillRolesType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of Party Involvement Roles associated with the Customer Bill. Contains the set of Party references to Individuals, Organisations or both that have a defined role with a Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Parts" type="tns:CustomerBillPartsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of components that make up the bulk of the definition of a Customer Bill. Includes both inherent components and references to other VBOs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillSummaryVBOType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer Bill Summary provides a summarised version of the Customer Bill, this provides the capability to get the Bill Header information without the Billed Usage.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:ExtendedBaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Details" type="tns:CustomerBillDetailsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The list of fields (data items) directly associated with a Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RelatedCustomerBills" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="RelatedCustomerBill" type="tns:RelatedCustomerBillReferenceType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference from this Customer Bill to another.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Roles" type="tns:CustomerBillRolesType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of Party Involvement Roles associated with the Customer Bill. Contains the set of Party references to Individuals, Organisations or both that have a defined role with a Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Parts" type="tns:CustomerBillSummaryPartsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of components that make up the bulk of the definition of a Customer Bill Summary. Includes both inherent components and references to the Customer and Billing accounts.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillLineItemVBOType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer Bill LineItem provides a Customer Bill Billed Usage information without the Summary or reference information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:ExtendedBaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Parts" type="tns:CustomerBillLineItemPartsType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of components that make up the bulk of the definition of a Customer Bill Line Item. Includes only the details and the LineItems.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The list of fields (data items) directly associated with a Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="DueDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The final date a payment may be received and processed to meet customer obligations for timely payment of the CustomerInvoice.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ChargeDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date through which charges previously received by the billing system appear on the bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CreditDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date through which credits previously received by the billing system appear on the bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="MailingDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A customer bill mailing date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AdjustedIndicator" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of whether this Customer Bill has been adjusted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="WrittenOffIndicator" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of whether an amount on this Customer Bill has been written off by the Issuer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ProductionTypeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The production type of the CustomerBill, such as regular bill, first bill, final bill, or revised final bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ProductionFrequencyQuantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The frequency of the bill production in the units of the frequency attribute in CustomerBillingCycleSpecification.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ProduceDocumentCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Whether a document should be produced or extracted or both for the CustomerBillSpec.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxPresentmentIndicator" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If value is TRUE tax will be calculated tax on each charge separately.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ZeroBalanceIndicator" type="cct:IndicatorType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates whether to zero the balance of the CustomerBillSpec at the billing run, for example in the case of internal employees.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="MultiplierNumber" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The frequency multiplier used for defining the cycle periods.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LastBilledAmount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total amount billed to the customer in the last bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LastOverdueAmount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The overdue amount from the last bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PaymentType" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The payment type of the bill</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillRolesType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of Party Involvement Roles associated with the Customer Bill. Contains the set of Party references to Individuals, Organisations or both that have a defined role with a Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Payer" type="tns:CustomerBillPayerRoleReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Party in the role of expected and actual payer of the Customer Bill. A reference to an Individual or and Organisation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Issuer" type="tns:CustomerBillIssuerRoleReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Party in the role of issuer of the Customer Bill. For Customer Bill this is expected to be a business unit, local market, within Vodafone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillRolesType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillPartsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of components that make up the bulk of the definition of a Customer Bill. Includes both inherent components and references to other VBOs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="AmountsDue" type="tns:CustomerBillAmountsDueType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component holding the amounts required of the Customer by the Issuer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AppliedBillingRates" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A sum of one or more other AppliedCustomerBillingRates formed by aggregating other AppliedCustomerBillingRates, which may be either Composite or Atomic AppliedCustomerBillingRates.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="AppliedBillingRate" type="tns:CustomerBillAppliedBillingRateType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Applied Customer Billing Rate (ACBR) of this Customer Bill. These are the charges applied against the Billing Account for the Subscriptions and Service Usage generated by the Customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BillingAccount" type="tns:CustomerBillingAccountReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Customer's Billing Account from which this Customer Bill was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CustomerAccount" type="tns:CustomerAccountReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Customer Account from which this Customer Bill was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BillingCycle" type="tns:CustomerBillBillingCycleType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Billing Cycle, the time period for which this Customer Bill was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BillFormat" type="tns:CustomerBillBillFormatType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The format of the bill to be presented to the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Documents" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Document" type="tns:CustomerBillDocumentType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference too or the actual binary object of an associated document to this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DueDateShiftPeriod" type="cmn:TimePeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The set of one-off charges assigned to the bill and included in the total amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="FinancialCharge" type="tns:CustomerBillFinancialChargeType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A one-off charge assigned to the bill and included in the total amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="LineItems" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="LineItem" type="tns:CustomerBillLineItemType" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Line Item of the Customer Bill representing the Billed Usage for which the payment of the recurring charges (applied billing rate) and the financial charges are being asked.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> name="SalesOrder" type="tns:SalesOrderReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Sales Order that generated this Customer Bill. Normally this relationship generates a number of one-off Financial Charges.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Specification" type="tns:CustomerBillSpecificationType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component used to store characteristics of the Customer Bill. <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A customer bill mailing date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CycleCloseDateTime" type="cct:DateTimeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A calendar date that specifies the cut off date for charges and credits to be included within this cycle run.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Instance" type="cct:NumericType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The serial occurrence of the cycle instance in a calendar year.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillBillingCycleType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillAppliedBillingRateType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Applied Customer Billing Rate (ACBR) of this Customer Bill. These are the charges applied against the Billing Account for the Subscriptions and Service Usage generated by the Customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A charge or a credit assigned to the customer's account in the course or for the purpose of the billing process. The net amount of the AppliedCustomerBillingRate in the Billing offer currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total tax amount of the AppliedCustomerBillingRate in the Billing offer currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ChargeCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A code associated with the AppliedCustomerBillingRate that defines several characteristics of the AppliedCustomerBillingRate, such as the description.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ValidityPeriod" type="cmn:ValidityPeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The start and end dates for the Billing Rate in which it is effective.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="MessageText" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The message to be displayed on the CustomerBill for the AppliedCustomerBillingRate.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillBillingRateType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillDocumentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference too or the actual binary object of an associated document to this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:AttachmentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillDocumentType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillLineItemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A Line Item of the Customer Bill representing the Billed Usage for which the payment of the recurring charges (applied billing rate) and the financial charges are being asked.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ChargeDate" type="cct:DateType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date of when the charge is applied</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="FinancialCharge" type="tns:CustomerBillFinancialChargeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A normalised aggregation of atomic Applied Customer Billing Rates to create a single Financial Charge</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ServiceUsage" type="tns:CustomerBillServiceUsageReferenceType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Customer's Service Usage (Billed Usage) from which the Customer Bill is generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillLineItemType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillNoteType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A comment or note about the generated Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:NoteType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillNoteType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SalesOrderReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Sales Order that generated this Customer Bill. Normally this relationship generates a number of one-off Financial Charges.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedSalesOrderReferenceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillSpecificationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component used to store characteristics of the Customer Bill. Relates to the Bill Spec in the Information Model, which also contains relationships to the Bill Format and the Bill Cycle Spec.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:SpecificationType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillSpecificationType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillStatusHistoryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The state lifecycle history of the Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:StatusHistoryType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillStatusHistoryType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SubscriptionReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to a Subscription (Product) for which this Customer Bill has been generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedSubscriptionReferenceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillAmountsDueType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component holding the amounts required of the Customer by the Issuer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total amount to be paid by the customer to the service provider as a result if this CustomerBill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AmountHandlingCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the specific handling performed on the total amount due of the (@LABEL CustomerBill}. The way the amount due of the CustomerBill is to be handled. For example zero the balance.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="NetAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The net amount to be paid by the customer to the service provider as a result if this CustomerBill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CreditedAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total net amount of credits that have been given for this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CreditedTaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total tax amount of credits that have been given for this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DisputeAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total net amount of disputes that are open for this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DisputeTaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total tax amount of disputes that are open for this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="OverPaymentAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount in overpayment, relevant for invoice receiver only.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="WrittenOffAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount that has been written off from this Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillAmountDueType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillTaxDueType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A component holding the tax amounts and the taxation details of the Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="TaxAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The tax amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxableAmount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount on which the tax was calculated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxAuthorityCode" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of a taxing authority, for example City, State, Federal. Valid values are retrieved from reference table.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxRateQuantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The rate of the tax. The ratio (usually expressed as a percentage) at which a business or person is taxed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxRatePercentage" type="cct:PercentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The rate of the tax. The ratio (usually expressed as a percentage) at which a business or person is taxed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TaxType" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of tax. For example VAT.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillTaxDueType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillServiceUsageReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference to the Customer's Service Usage (Billed Usage) from which the Customer Bill is generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="cmn:BaseComponentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Usage amount (money).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Quantity" type="cct:QuantityType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Usage quantity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TimePeriod" type="cmn:TimePeriodType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Period of Time in which the Usage was generated by the Subscription.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillServiceUsageReferenceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillBillFormatType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The format of the bill to be presented to the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Name" type="cct:TextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Bill Format to use for the Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Description" type="cct:TextType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The description of the Bill Format to use for the Customer Bill.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillBillFormatType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CustomerBillFinancialChargeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A one-off charge assigned to the bill and included in the total amount.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Amount" type="cct:AmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of the financial charge.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Type" type="cct:CodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of the financial charge.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Extension" type="extvbo:ExtendedCustomerBillFinancialChargeType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="actionCode" type="cmn:ActionCodeType" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The @actionCode attribute is used within a modification operation to indicate the action (add, update, delete) intended on a component.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>
